I run a new nanny service. Prior to me running this nanny service, Someone that I've hired in the past to nanny my own kids is asking to work for my new company.
However, my kids didn't like her as a nanny and I've heard from other people that had hired her in the past that they wouldn't hire her again. 

How can I politely and professionally tell her that I will not be hiring her for my new nanny service?

Subject: Nanny Application Status Update

Dear [Nanny's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. Firstly, I would like to thank you for your interest in working with our new nanny service. We appreciate the time and effort you have taken to apply for a position with our company.

After careful consideration, I have decided not to move forward with your application at this time. As a new business, we are focusing on building a team with a diverse range of skills, experiences, and backgrounds. While your previous experience as a nanny is certainly valuable, we believe that we need to explore other options that may better align with our current business objectives.

Please understand that this decision was not made lightly, and I truly appreciate your interest in working with us. I wish you the best of luck in your future endeavors and hope that you will find a position that is a great fit for your skills and experience.

Thank you once again for considering our company, and please do not hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or concerns.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]
[Your Title]
[Your Company Name]
Can you re-write it to be slightly less formal?

Subject: Update on Your Application

Hi [Nanny's Name],

I hope you're doing well! I wanted to reach out and let you know about the status of your application to join our nanny service. Thank you for your interest in working with us – we really appreciate it.

After giving it some thought, we've decided not to move forward with your application right now. As we're building our team, we're looking for a mix of different skills, experiences, and backgrounds. Although you have nanny experience, we think it's best to explore other options that might be a better fit for our company at the moment.

I want you to know that this wasn't an easy decision, and we're grateful for your interest in working with us. I hope you'll find a great opportunity that matches your skills and experience soon.

If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out. Best of luck in your future endeavors!

Take care,

[Your Name]
[Your Title]
[Your Company Name]
